review: The Fire TV is a fairly competent streaming box for most users. It will run netflix, hulu, prime, etc without any issue. It also has some access to games, and a decent little controller for those.I run Kodi, epsxe, and a few other emulators on it. You can pair a PS4 controller directly to the box and be up and running very quickly. You can also expand the storage with a USB hard drive.My BIG gripe with this box, which is otherwise perfect for my needs, is that you have to side load many applications (emulators, xbmc, etc.) and you have very little control over what is on your homescreen. In order to get to sideloaded applications you have to go through a menu that's burried about four layers deep. Everything runs through a REALLY terrible interface that's made to pitch every amazon product they can try to sell you. Amazon, let me change my home screen around and make shortcuts to my sideloaded apps and I will revise my review.
author: me

review: We are so happy with our Amazon Fire TV as it is easy to use as we are older and sometimes have a hard time using new technology.  My son has the Apple for his TV to use Net Flex,etc and he was amazed at the Fire TV device.  So great he thought and wished that he had it.  Definitely a great buy.  We love the voice activation part of the Fire TV to call up different movies.
author: Karen

review: This is a great device. Very fast. My only complaint is that Amazon Music acts a little flaky. It will intermittently stop streaming music- usually when it's switching from one track to the next. A push on the play button will start the music streaming again. TV Shows and Movies do not do this. They stream exceptionally well. Over all, a great device.
